name: Centro de Convenciones Internacional de Barcelona

reviews.text:
Large barn like conference venue. Main exhibition hall has reasonable air con at the front, a bit stuffy at the back. Lecture halls have good acoustics 
Meeting rooms upstairs however rather warm (it wasn’t hot outside, in fact it rained most of the week)

I attended the EAHP annual congress at CCIB this week. It turns out that the street the venue is on is accessible only by foot so you have to know where you are going or you wont find it.

Once inside , the venue has good signage and is easy to navigate. Wear comfortable shoes; you may walk quite a distance.

As noted in another review, the area is lovely and there are a number of fine eateries within a 5 minute walk.

Attending EyeforPharma here this week.  Very easy conference centre to visit.  Lots of hotels directly situated around the convention centre + there is a large mall across the street with a huge food court.  The centre is close to the beach and facilities look ok.  Not a lot of catering on site.
Here you can take a break at the nearby beaches that go on for kilometres onto City or just enjoy the conference , good seating and services

Adequate toilet facilities - the line queue in the ladies moved quite quickly.
Comfortable seating with great views of the stage - regardless of where we sat. 
Located close to a major shopping centre which offered great options for meals in between sessions. The grocery shopping at a low price was an added bonus to stock up our apartment.

The size of this venue is obviously a draw for very large conferences but the management shouldn't forget to address the detail (below) so that a good venue becomes a great venue.

I was a booth exhibitor for two days and experienced the following:

- The door staff (ticketing, cloakroom and outside restaurant areas), were unfriendly and unhelpful when I asked for directions, given the size of the venue when you first arrive.
- General food areas ran out of quite a few food options by about 1.15pm, after only starting to serve at 12.00
- the toilets were a long way from the main foyer
- For end of day food and or drink booth activity, please don't bring the tables to the booth at mid-day, ready for 5 hours later, which just acts as a barrier to speaking with delegates, plus we don't need the ice containers and wine bottles mid-afternoon for 2+ hours later
This must be only one of a very few places in Europe which can handle a congress of many thousands. It has lots of large halls and great views over the Mediterranean.

Very good hotel very good location 
Upgraded to a premium jacuzzi room 
The design of the room is great & very spacious 
The jacuzzi was really fantastic 
No ac control in room # 404
Amenities was very good
Front desk staff very friendly 
I will definitely come again
Samba 
Ethiopia

Centrally located. Easy access.
Food in the center was not satisfactory. We had to get out the center to fnd decent food.
Cleaning ladies did their best to keep the toilets clean.
Security was ok but not strict.
Enough space for over 8,000 participants.

This is well known conference center among medical community. Well organized, spacious, clean and fully equipped. Perfect for a middle sized conference. But there is an outstanding feature, the catering. We had a buffet lunch, and it was the best of Catalan kitchen in terms of salad, fish and meat!
Very typical average convention centre that feels a little outdated. Not too large with OK orientation. Outside the city centre but well connected.

Food location with adjacent hotels.

Plenary room is state of the art, else average with small rooms lacking decent AC and very limited bathroom facilities.

As Europe has hardly and decent sized conference centers, this one is popular and not the worst.

The center is well maintained the entrance is just perfect,It is huge and each area is very well connected with washroom and eatery is easily accessible,the fira is well connected by Public transport and have hotel and shopping center nearby.
Finding Taxi during the peak time will be a nightmare.

I have been here for Gartner Symposium - around 8000 CIOs meet in multiple parallel sessions to find out where the world of technology is going. There are few places in Europe that can handle this size of crowd and do it so well.
I was here for attending openstack summit 2016. Wonderful place with neat design. Quite easy to navigate around. Fine catering, friendly and efficient service. Clean bathrooms.

was there, and the place is really big, with huge rooms, and the security is everywhere.
Great event and Great place

Very good conference venue; broad spaces, various room sizes, agreeable indoor 'climate'. Very appropriate A/C: you often freeze - not here. Quite easy to navigate around. Fine catering, friendly and efficient service. Clean bathrooms.
Absolutely recommendable, also due to the many hotels in the direct neighbourhood and closeness to beach and promenade.
Taxi from airport about 20 mins (outside rush hour).

Great mall that has everything, amazing food great variety of stores to shop huge supermarket electronic stores. It's a one stop shop for anything you would like to buy. Great coffee shops along with delicious bakeries

Here for CIRSE September 2016. 32 C outside but air conditioning able to cope. Very good AV facilities, catering ok. About 5km from town. Lots of hotels nearby, good restaurants also and it's next to the beach. All you need
We were here for the AMEE. Conference. In August 2016. Great conference venue, lovely food, friendly staff. A bit awkward finding your way around?, but once you have, it's ok ,
I have been to this venue on several occasions for business conferences. It is a great professional venue with great staff and well laid out.
Beside the museum of natural history. It's a huge building where we had our convention. It was able to accommodate I think more than 500 attendees. The convention halls were very big.
I am very often in this area and also attended several events and conferences in this center. It is a very good and well organized convention center in the new neighborhood of the city.

This is a really great conference venue. I came in October 2015 and was impressed by the size and space. The wifi in the main room never worked which was very frustrating, but the wifi worked everybody else. The location is a bit far out so I had to get a cab there and back to my hotel.
The convention center was good, but I did not give it a max because of NO wifi. It was in a good area, with a mall across the street and easy access to the subway.

I went here for Mobile World congress 2015. This place is massive and very well organized. The public transport is very easy to reach and they make sure that you know where you have to go. It would be nice to have some more places to buy food and drinks, but perhaps MWC was just a bit to big.

The conference centre is at the far end of diagonal street about 30 minutes walk from the city centre but right on the metro line so easy to access it. The conference was interesting and the conference centre is adequate but has no cafe to get a drink or meet colleagues. It is right accross the road from the shopping centre but sometimes it's nice to stay inside the venue in the middle of the day. It's air conditioned and had enough  toilets and meeting rooms and is attached to the hotel if you want to have meetings there. There is wifi in the co defence centre
great choice if you want to have exhibitions here. BICA staff is always welcoming you at this old landmark. Go for it.
Attended the ESICM conference here. Great location by the waterfront, high ceilings and fantastic audiovisual equipment in all the rooms. This is a great venue for any conference/meeting.

I attended the European Society of Cardiology Congress at Fira Gran Via. It is a huge modern center equipped to handle many types of conventions/exhibitions. There is a nearby train station which allows easy access from the city center.

Attended a conference here.
Pros - excellent location. Well connected by metro and bus. Plenty of hotels around. Shopping centre nearby if family needs to spend time around. A very good beach and a good walkway around the beach. 
Conference venue itself has good sized rooms of multiple capacities to accommodate the varying numbers. Plenty of space for exhibitors to have products displayed. 
Cons - the venue needs to be sign posted better for people to reach it. The wifi provided does not cover all the areas within the venue. In the main auditorium which is a short walk through the gates and in through the basement corridor is good with excellent seating and acoustic but wifi was a problem!
The convention center is very well organized. If you looking for a place that can hold a medium sized convention, this is the place. A lot of hotels very close.

It is very good located for all participants for each kind of events. I attended EASL meeting here and convention center is very useful for the meetings. All areas commodious.Administrative staff are also very kind and helpful.

Very spacious and very well organized. Very conveniently located, 2 minutes walk from the tram station and 5-minute walk from the subway station. Just next to the beautiful beach. Great view from the upper floors.
